this_group_users.description: List of IAM users in IAM group
List of IAM users in IAM group

attach_iam_self_management_policy.description: Whether to attach IAM policy which allows IAM users to manage their credentials and MFA

aws_account_id.description: AWS account id to use inside IAM policies. If empty, current AWS account ID will be used.

custom_group_policies.description: List of maps of inline IAM policies to attach to IAM group. Should have `name` and `policy` keys in each element.

custom_group_policy_arns.description: List of IAM policies ARNs to attach to IAM group

group_users.description: List of IAM users to have in an IAM group which can assume the role

iam_self_management_policy_name_prefix.description: Name prefix for IAM policy to create with IAM self-management permissions

this_group_users.description: List of IAM users in IAM group

attach_iam_self_management_policy.description: Whether to attach IAM policy which allows IAM users to manage their credentials and MFA

aws_account_id.description: AWS account id to use inside IAM policies. If empty, current AWS account ID will be used.

custom_group_policies.description: List of maps of inline IAM policies to attach to IAM group. Should have `name` and `policy` keys in each element.

custom_group_policy_arns.description: List of IAM policies ARNs to attach to IAM group

group_users.description: List of IAM users to have in an IAM group which can assume the role

iam_self_management_policy_name_prefix.description: Name prefix for IAM policy to create with IAM self-management permissions

pgp_key.description: PGP key used to encrypt sensitive data for this user (if empty - secrets are not encrypted)

this_iam_access_key_key_fingerprint.description: The fingerprint of the PGP key used to encrypt the secret

this_iam_access_key_ses_smtp_password_v4.description: The secret access key converted into an SES SMTP password by applying AWS's Sigv4 conversion algorithm

this_iam_access_key_status.description: Active or Inactive. Keys are initially active, but can be made inactive by other means.

this_iam_user_arn.description: The ARN assigned by AWS for this user

this_iam_user_login_profile_key_fingerpr.description: The fingerprint of the PGP key used to encrypt the password

this_iam_user_ssh_key_fingerprint.description: The MD5 message digest of the SSH public key

this_iam_user_ssh_key_ssh_public_key_id.description: The unique identifier for the SSH public key

this_iam_user_unique_id.description: The unique ID assigned by AWS

create_iam_access_key.description: Whether to create IAM access key

create_iam_user_login_profile.description: Whether to create IAM user login profile

create_user.description: Whether to create the IAM user

force_destroy.description: When destroying this user, destroy even if it has non-Terraform-managed IAM access keys, login profile or MFA devices. Without force_destroy a user with non-Terraform-managed access keys and login profile will fail to be destroyed.

name.description: Desired name for the IAM user

password_length.description: The length of the generated password

password_reset_required.description: Whether the user should be forced to reset the generated password on first login.

path.description: Desired path for the IAM user

permissions_boundary.description: The ARN of the policy that is used to set the permissions boundary for the user.

pgp_key.description: Either a base-64 encoded PGP public key, or a keybase username in the form `keybase:username`. Used to encrypt password and access key. `pgp_key` is required when `create_iam_user_login_profile` is set to `true`

ssh_key_encoding.description: Specifies the public key encoding format to use in the response. To retrieve the public key in ssh-rsa format, use SSH. To retrieve the public key in PEM format, use PEM

ssh_public_key.description: The SSH public key. The public key must be encoded in ssh-rsa format or PEM format

tags.description: A map of tags to add to all resources.

upload_iam_user_ssh_key.description: Whether to upload a public ssh key to the IAM user
